summary: The Magic of Us - Chapter 6 - Notes on the Quidditch Teams
title: The Magic of Us - Chapter 6 - Notes on the Quidditch Teams
body:
Stark Quidditch Team (aka the Year 4 Team, due to most players being in Year 4)

Seeker: Ygritte (Year 4)

Beaters (2): Robin Flint (Year 6), Smalljon Umber (Year 7; Captain)

Chasers (3): Robb Stark (Year 4), Jon Snow (Year 4), Meera Reed (Year 4)

Keeper: Lyra Mormont (Year 4)


Lannister Quidditch Team

Seeker: Talla Tarly (Year 3)

Beaters (2): Sandor (Year 1), Merlon Crakehall (Year 5)

Chasers (3): Lancel (Year 5), Bronn (Year 1), Alysanne Lefford (Year 4)

Keeper: Addam Marbrand (Year 6; Captain)

Chapter 6 is now up, and is a bit more of a plot chapter. We’ll be back to the Sansan in Chapter 7. :)

summary: I’m probably wrong but IMO the thought that Sansa will braid Dany’s hair, sew her wedding dress etc etc is worse than “Sansa...
question: I’m probably wrong but IMO the thought that Sansa will braid Dany’s hair, sew her wedding dress etc etc is worse than “Sansa will betray__” because it’s essentially saying that Sansa’s a good person only if she submits to Dany first.
answer:
That’s exactly what it is. It’s that really irritating thing people like to do, under the guise of, “Stop pitting women against each other!!”, like there aren’t actual reasons for Sansa to be displeased. And it’s not about Sansa at all, it’s about affirming Daenerys’ greatness and needing everyone to fall at her feet to further prop her character up, even if it comes at the expense of another. If Sansa is expected to drop to her knee for Daenerys and her claim (through her mad father, after half the country came together to dispose of him and his line) to the Iron Throne, why isn’t Daenerys expected to do the same for Sansa and her claim (should she make one) to the North? Girls support girls, right?

Sansa and the Starks have suffered through hell in the name of the North. Robb and Cat were murdered so others could lay claim to it while they sought independence, Bran and Rickon displaced and on the run when Theon tried to take Winterfell, Arya left with no home to return to, Rickon killed so Ramsay could possess it without threat. Sansa was abused by the Lannisters so they could control the North through her, groomed and manipulated by Littlefinger so he could use it as a stepping stone to more, raped and tortured by Ramsay so he get his heir and solidify his hold on the North for once and for all. Giving it away is no joke; she and the Northern lords are absolutely entitled to be angry and unwelcoming of a Targaryen leader, especially when the threat of the WW is to all of Westeros. The North goes, so does the rest. So why is the North given away as a prize so someone who proclaims themselves as queen can defend her own kingdom?

I don’t expect the animosity to last long or even matter at all once the bigger problem makes itself known, but it’s stupid and disingenuous to act like Sansa should gratefully roll out the red carpet and take up a part time job as Daenerys’ gushing handmaid. It reduces her to another mindless prop (don’t we have enough of those?) and goes against everything we already know her to be.

blog.description: Totally obsessed with Got and Jonsa stuff duh. Sansa's my precious babe.(Also Kataang shipper, Potterhead, love The Walking Dead, Marvel fan, Loki’s wife and LoTR)

summary:
Did you think they did it alone?
Built whole armies, and conquered thrones?
Constructed promised lands that would outlive the...
body:
Did you think they did it alone?

Built whole armies, and conquered thrones?

Constructed promised lands that would outlive the sun?

Resurrected prosperity from ash and bone?

A crest is not just a man made thing, it is also created by a generation of women who wield swords through guile and letters.

Show me your Kings, and I will show you the Queens that willed them, that bred them, that taught them to do better.

-Of Kings And Queens

summary: I will never get over how enraged Jon’s face was in the crypt scene with Littlefinger. Mind you, a lot of awful shit has...
body:
I will never get over how enraged Jon’s face was in the crypt scene with Littlefinger. Mind you, a lot of awful shit has happened to Jon in the past seven seasons of Game of Thrones but Jon has NEVER reacted so violently to anyone else in the show! There is literally no previous scene that you can compare his rage too. When that scene came out and after season 7 aired there were a lot of people who were not only upset about the writing in season 7, but specifically upset about that particular scene with Jon. Many believed that Jon’s reaction to Littlefinger was so out of character and that it didn’t make sense for Jon to react so violently to Littlefinger. Also many people thought it was an injustice to Littlefinger. For a character as smart and strategic as he was people couldn’t wrap their mind around why he would blantanly provoke Jon and reveal his feelings for Sansa. They couldn’t understand what he was trying to accomplish.

The funny thing is that the criticism this scene has received is ABSOLUTELY VALID! Yes, Jon is protective of Sansa but based on the Jon we’ve seen in the show, his reaction was abnormal and extremely out of character. Also Littlefinger isn’t usually so blatant with his manipulations and emotions. He’s usually pretty tactful. With that being said, that’s why I think this scene was the biggest tell-tale sign that Jon has deeper feelings for Sansa than he realizes. Make no mistake, the crypt scene was not filler for season 7! Littlefinger wasn’t just “poking the bear” for no reason. I believe that scene was created to further push this story along to where it will eventually lead. The purpose of that scene wasn’t to highlight the danger/threat of Littlefinger to Jon and Sansa’s relationship. We knew Littlefinger was a threat from season 6. The purpose of this scene was to REVEAL feelings/weaknesses hidden underneath the surface. Jon’s violent reaction was the entire point of that scene. It was something that we as an audience were immediately supposed to take notice of.

Another point that I want to mention is this. In the history of this show have you ever seen Littlefinger look confused?! Have you ever seen him look bewildered like he didn’t know what just happened? His excecution aside, Littlefinger has definitely been caught off guard before but he’s never had a look of confusion. He usually has the upper hand in scenes often manipulating the individual he’s speaking to and privy to their secrets. But this time around in this particular scene that wasn’t the case. For the first time Littlefinger seems dumbfounded by the events that occurred until “something” dawns on him and he stares at Sansa.

Also Littlefinger isn’t usually so blatant with his manipulations and emotions. He’s usually pretty tactful. With that being said, that’s why I think this scene was the biggest tell-tale sign that Jon has deeper feelings for Sansa than he realizes. Make no mistake, the crypt scene was not filler for season 7! Littlefinger wasn’t just “poking the bear” for no reason. I believe that scene was created to further push this story along to where it will eventually lead. The purpose of that scene wasn’t to highlight the danger/threat of Littlefinger to Jon and Sansa’s relationship. We knew Littlefinger was a threat from season 6. The purpose of this scene was to REVEAL feelings/weaknesses hidden underneath the surface. Jon’s violent reaction was the entire point of that scene. It was something that we as an audience were immediately supposed to take notice of.

Another point that I want to mention is this. In the history of this show have you ever seen Littlefinger look confused?! Have you ever seen him look bewildered like he didn’t know what just happened? His excecution aside, Littlefinger has definitely been caught off guard before but he’s never had a look of confusion. He usually has the upper hand in scenes often manipulating the individual he’s speaking to and privy to their secrets. But this time around in this particular scene that wasn’t the case. For the first time Littlefinger seems dumbfounded by the events that occurred until “something” dawns on him and he stares at Sansa.
trail.content:
I will never get over how enraged Jon’s face was in the crypt scene with Littlefinger. Mind you, a lot of awful shit has happened to Jon in the past seven seasons of Game of Thrones but Jon has NEVER reacted so violently to anyone else in the show! There is literally no previous scene that you can compare his rage too. When that scene came out and after season 7 aired there were a lot of people who were not only upset about the writing in season 7, but specifically upset about that particular scene with Jon. Many believed that Jon’s reaction to Littlefinger was so out of character and that it didn’t make sense for Jon to react so violently to Littlefinger. Also many people thought it was an injustice to Littlefinger. For a character as smart and strategic as he was people couldn’t wrap their mind around why he would blantanly provoke Jon and reveal his feelings for Sansa. They couldn’t understand what he was trying to accomplish.

The funny thing is that the criticism this scene has received is ABSOLUTELY VALID! Yes, Jon is protective of Sansa but based on the Jon we’ve seen in the show, his reaction was abnormal and extremely out of character. Also Littlefinger isn’t usually so blatant with his manipulations and emotions. He’s usually pretty tactful. With that being said, that’s why I think this scene was the biggest tell-tale sign that Jon has deeper feelings for Sansa than he realizes. Make no mistake, the crypt scene was not filler for season 7! Littlefinger wasn’t just “poking the bear” for no reason. I believe that scene was created to further push this story along to where it will eventually lead. The purpose of that scene wasn’t to highlight the danger/threat of Littlefinger to Jon and Sansa’s relationship. We knew Littlefinger was a threat from season 6. The purpose of this scene was to REVEAL feelings/weaknesses hidden underneath the surface. Jon’s violent reaction was the entire point of that scene. It was something that we as an audience were immediately supposed to take notice of.

Another point that I want to mention is this. In the history of this show have you ever seen Littlefinger look confused?! Have you ever seen him look bewildered like he didn’t know what just happened? His excecution aside, Littlefinger has definitely been caught off guard before but he’s never had a look of confusion. He usually has the upper hand in scenes often manipulating the individual he’s speaking to and privy to their secrets. But this time around in this particular scene that wasn’t the case. For the first time Littlefinger seems dumbfounded by the events that occurred until “something” dawns on him and he stares at Sansa.

summary:
(After a big party that Sansa, Loras, Renly, and Margaery went to where everyone got drunk)
Sansa: I’ve been dry heaving all...
body:
(After a big party that Sansa, Loras, Renly, and Margaery went to where everyone got drunk)

Sansa: I’ve been dry heaving all weekend. When my mother asked what the sound was, I told her I was practicing bird calls.
